general_advisory: Keeping the rainfall forecast in mind, farmers are advised to take necessary precautions as per the specific advisory provided.

advisory: After receding of rain water, there is a chance of infestation of Swarming Caterpillar. To manage this, spray Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% EC @ 400-ml/acre or Lambda-cyhalothrin @ 400-ml/acre.
Sheath rot and sheath blight may occur in paddy. To manage this disease, spray Tebuconazole 50%+ Trifloxystrobin 25% WG @ 80-gram/acre or Propiconazole 25% EC @ 200ml/acre.

Rainfall after a dry spell may aggravate infestation of fall army worm in maize. To manage the pest, spray biopesticide Beauveria bassiana @ 1200-gram/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water. Dust mixture of sand, soil and wooden ash inside the leaf whorl so that the caterpillars cannot feed on the leaves.

To manage the pest chemically, spray Emamectin Benzoate 5% S.G @ 80-gram/acre or Spinetoram 11.7% S.C @ 100-ml/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% S.C @ 80-ml/acre. 200 litres of water per acre are required to spray the insecticide.

There are chances of infestation of Downy Mildew disease in cucurbit vegetables after heavy rainfall. To manage Downy Mildew disease in cucurbits, spray Copper Hydroxide 77% WP @ 3-gram/litre or Fosetyl -AL 80% WP @ 3-gram/litre or Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63% WP @ 2-gram/litre.

There are chances of damping off disease in vegetable nursery like tomato, brinjal, chili. To manage it, drench nursery bed with 2-gram Captan/litre of water or 2.5-gram Copper Oxychloride/litre of water.
To manage wilt and rot disease in vegetable crops, drench the root zone with a solution of 1.5-gram Streptocycline and 20-gram Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP mixed in 10 litres of water.
Heavy rainfall might have decreased the salinity of water in the pond. Farmers are advised to apply alky-dimethyl-benzyl ammonium chloride (3ppm) as a disinfectant after the cessation of rain.
